alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 04 at 11:43PM CDT until May 05 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Cleveland County in central Oklahoma... Northwestern McClain County in central Oklahoma... Southern Oklahoma County in central Oklahoma... * Until 245 AM CDT. * At 1143 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1.25 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oklahoma City, western Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Choctaw, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Jones, Nicoma Park, Valley Brook, Tinker Air Force Base, Stanley Draper Lake, Forest Park, Lake Aluma, Smith Village, The Capitol, Will Rogers Airport and The Fairgrounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 109 and 133. Interstate 44 between mile markers 104 and 121...and between mile markers 125 and 130. Interstate 40 between mile markers 146 and 164. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 15. This includes the following streams and drainages... North Fork Little River, Bishop Creek, Cow Creek, Hog Creek, Imhoff Creek, North Canadian River, Lightning Creek, Crooked Oak Creek, Silver Creek, West Branch Hog Creek, West Elm Creek, Canadian River, Twin Creek, Choctaw Creek, Soldier Creek, Rock Creek, Little River and Pond Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1.25 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
